One of the recent manifestations of this trend is a significant move by BlackRock, a global investment giant renowned for its crypto-friendly inclinations. The firm has recently formed a significant partnership in India to drive a ‚Äòdigital-first‚Äô investment initiative.
BlackRock‚Äôs expansion into India is in collaboration with Jio Financial Services (JFS), a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, the most valued firm in India, owned by the industry titan Mukesh Ambani. This collaboration aims to introduce investment solutions to millions of Indian investors.
The Birth Of Jio BlackRock

Biggest Movers: SOL Nears $26.00 Resistance Level, MATIC Moves Away From Support
entry.summary:
Solana was once again in the green, with bulls pushing the token towards a key resistance level at $26.00. The move comes after yesterday‚Äôs 7% surge, however earlier gains have since declined, as U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) grew 2.4% as opposed to the 1.8% expectation for Q2. Polygon also climbed higher today, bouncing from a support level around $0.7000.
Solana (SOL)
Solana (SOL) moved closer to a long-term resistance level of $26.00 on Thursday, as sentiment in the token remained bullish.
Following a low of $24.45 on Wednesday, SOL/USD surged to an intraday high of $25.59 earlier in today‚Äôs session.
As a result of the move, solana climbed to its highest point since last Saturday, when price peaked at $25.97.
One of the reasons behind today‚Äôs rally appears to be a breakout which took place at a ceiling of 59.00 on the relative strength index (RSI).
As of writing, the index is now tracking at 59.90, with SOL bulls giving up some of their earlier gains.
Despite climbing by nearly 10% in the past two days, the token is down by 2.80% in the past week, following a recent bear run.
Polygon (MATIC)
Polygon (MATIC) bounced from a recent support point earlier in today‚Äôs session, as bulls rejected an extended sell-off.
MATIC/USD peaked at $0.7347 on Thursday, a day after falling to a bottom at the $0.7124 mark.
The initial move came as the world‚Äôs 11th largest cryptocurrency continued to climb away from floor at $0.7000.
This coincided with the RSI moving away from a support level of its own at 45.00. It is now tracking at 48.24.
Despite this, the 10-day (red) and 25-day (blue) moving averages still look set for a downward cross in the coming days.
Should this occur, the next target for sellers will likely be near the $0.5900 zone.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will polygon maintain its floor at $0.7000 this week? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: CoinsPaid Resumes Operations After $37 Million Hack, But Who Did It?
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrency processing platform CoinsPaid has resumed operations after suffering a significant hack last week. The event, which occurred on July 22, forced the platform to put a hold on its operations for four days.¬†
However, the question on everyone‚Äôs lips is who hacked the platform? In response to this, the firm has accused the Lazarus Group of being responsible for the spate of attacks on its internal systems leading to the loss of $37.3 million.¬†
CoinsPaid Falls Victim to Latest Lazarus Group Attacks
In a press release published on July 26, CoinsPaid confirmed that its security had suffered breaches resulting in a loss of $37.5 million. The firm fingered North Korean state-backed Lazarus Group, a notorious and powerful hacker body, as the one responsible.¬†
It noted that th‚Ä¶

entry.title: What is Fiat Money? How does it work?, History, Pros & Cons
entry.summary: Introduction Defining Fiat Money Fiat money is tender not backed by a tangible asset or commodity like gold or silver. It‚Äôs usually mandated by governments, but this isn‚Äôt always the case. The currencies we use for everyday transactions in the modern era are all examples of fiat money, such as the U.S. dollar (USD), the euro (EUR), the pound (GBP) or the Chinese Yuan (CNY). The term ‚Äúfiat‚Äù is a Latin word that means ‚Äúby decree‚Äù or ‚Äúlet it be done,‚Äù representing an arbitrary order that reflects the issuance of money as a government enactment. Fiat is one form of money, along with representative and commodity money. While fiat money comes in various forms ‚Äî physical banknotes, coins or digital units ‚Äî representative money merely ‚Äúrepresents‚Äù an intent to pay, like a cheque. Commodity money h‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Authorities Drop Charges Against SBF Involving Campaign Finance Funds
entry.summary:
In the latest court filing, the United States Department of Justice (DoJ) announced its decision to withdraw the campaign finance charge against Sam ‚ÄúSBF‚Äù Bankman-Fried, the founder and former CEO of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX.
In a correspondence addressed to the court on Wednesday, US Attorney Damian Williams stated:
In keeping with its treaty obligations to The Bahamas, the government does not intend to proceed to trial on the campaign contributions count
The US government considered the extradition document in regard to the charges, which included the specific charge related to campaign contributions, and sought consultation with The Bahamas before making the decision.
Initially, the DoJ had the intention of pursuing the campaign finance charge against SBF. Howev‚Ä¶

entry.title: Prosecutors Want Sam Bankman-Fried Jailed Ahead of Trial
entry.summary:
U.S. prosecutors have asked a federal judge to put crypto exchange FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried in jail over alleged witness tampering before his trial starts in October. While requiring the prosecution to formalize the request and giving the defense enough time to make its case, the judge issued a temporary gag order restricting their public comments.
Prosecutors Seek Sam Bankman-Fried‚Äôs Detention Over Witness-Tampering Allegations
During a hearing on Wednesday, prosecutors in the case against Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF), founder and former chief executive of the failed digital asset exchange FTX, asked U.S. District Court Judge Lewis Kaplan to send the crypto entrepreneur to jail.
SBF has been living under house arrest in his parents‚Äô home in Palo Alto, California since December 2022‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Human Rights Foundation Announces 20 BTC Bounty Challenge For Bitcoin Development
entry.summary: In what is perhaps the most articulate and thorough Bitcoin grant offering to date, the Human Rights Foundation (HRF) has announced a 20 BTC set of bounty challenges in support of open-source Bitcoin developers building tools and services that increase the functionality of Bitcoin. These selections, inspired by the HRF‚Äôs research and work with activists across the world, were carefully chosen to perpetuate usability and increase privacy applications within Bitcoin, the Lightning Network, ecash and Nostr. The challenges will run through the end of 2024, with any unclaimed bounties being converted back into the HRF‚Äôs Bitcoin Development Fund. The bounties themselves have a clear privacy, censorship-resistance, and self-sovereignty focus, bringing much needed attention towards some of the gr‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Crime: South Korea Intelligence Unit Offers Support To Virtual Asset Operators
entry.summary:
In its continuous attempt to regulate its evolving crypto scene and fight against crypto crimes, the South Korean government has offered support to virtual asset operators in the country. The nation‚Äôs Financial Intelligence Unit recently held a meeting with five local virtual asset services providers to help strengthen their ‚Äúcompliance capabilities.‚Äù
This meeting is a follow-up move by the South Korean authorities after the recent organization of an interagency investigation unit to combat crypto-related crimes.
Korea Finance Intelligence Unit Meets Virtual Asset Operators
On July 27, 2023, the Korea Finance Intelligence Unit (FIU) held an advisory meeting focused on bolstering the response to illegal activities related to virtual assets. This meeting primarily involved a group of f‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed title‚Äîand made Crypto Unicorns instead.
